sentences.en: Hawaii was the birthplace of surfing.
sentences.cn: 夏威夷是冲浪运动的发源地。

sentences.en: He spends holiday at the seashore, and goes to participate in surfing every day.
sentences.cn: 他在海滨度假, 并天天去参加冲浪运动.

sentences.en: I know swimming, surfing, diving, water - skiing, and rowing.
sentences.cn: 我知道游泳 、 冲浪 、 跳水 、 滑水和赛艇.

sentences.en: I think surfing the Internet is wonderful.
I'm crazy about surfing the Internet.
I'm going to be surfing bigger waves when I get to Australia!
sentences.cn: 到了澳大利亚后我要去浪头更大的地方冲浪！

sentences.en: If the waves are big enough, we'll go surfing.
sentences.cn: 如果海浪大, 我们就去冲浪.

sentences.en: In wintertime he will don a wet suit and go right on surfing.
sentences.cn: 到冬季,他就穿上橡皮紧身衣去冲浪.

sentences.en: Sometimes I just like surfing the net.
sentences.cn: 有时,我就是喜欢在网上冲浪.

sentences.en: The simple fact is that, for most people, surfing is too expensive.
sentences.cn: 事情很简单，那就是对大多数人来说，网上冲浪费用太高。

sentences.en: The weather's great the whole year round, and the surfing is fabulous.
sentences.cn: 那儿全年气候都很好, 冲浪更是好玩儿.

sentences.en: What's the point of surfing the Internet?
When we were in Hawaii, we went surfing every day.
sentences.cn: 我们在夏威夷时每天都去冲浪。

sentences.en: Wind surfing can be strenuous but immensely exciting.
sentences.cn: 风帆冲浪可能紧张吃力，但却非常刺激。

sentences.en: You can't surf at night. I always go surfing in the morning.
sentences.cn: 你不能在晚上冲浪. 我总是在早上去冲浪.

trans.tran_en: the activity or sport of riding over the waves on a special board
